item.title: Do you need ngrok to develop Microsoft Teams apps?
item.description: If you’ve started down the path of developing applications for Microsoft Teams, you may have seen a tool called ngrok as a prerequisite in various tutorials and lab exercises.

item.title: New VSCode extension for autocompleting your Microsoft Graph APIs
item.description: While working on a project which uses Microsoft Graph APIs, I found myself opening the Microsoft Graph Explorer a lot to check which paths/parameters were available.

item.title: What's up with Markdown?
item.description: Perhaps you’ve noticed a technology called Markdown that’s been showing up in a lot of web sites and apps lately.

item.title: Add Developer PowerShell and Developer Command Prompt for Visual Studio to Windows Terminal
item.description: Windows Terminal is great, I use it for all my command line work.

item.title: How to get started with Graph Explorer
item.description: Microsoft Graph offers us a single endpoint https://graph.microsoft.com to access data in Microsoft 365, Windows 10, and Enterprise Mobility and Security and can be used by makers and developers.

item.title: To write code comments or not, it should not be a question
item.description: Comments, just do it. I write this post because I read a couple of articles, and messages on social platforms about stop using comments in your code.

item.title: How to enhance your "dev tenant" to unleash the full potential of the Power Platform
item.description: The Microsoft 365 Developer tenant is an amazing feature to learn and experiment in the Microsoft 365 universe (actually I’m talking about your personal development “sandbox” of the Microsoft 365 developer program.

item.title: Use Node Version Manager to develop your SPFx apps
item.description: To develop applications for SharePoint or Microsoft Teams with the SPFx framework, a few requirements must be met on your development computer.

item.title: What is a "Dev Tenant" and why would you want one?
item.description: By visiting Developer Program - Microsoft 365 and selecting “Join Now” you’ll be walked through a wizard that will help you provision your very own Microsoft 365 tenant.
